channel.title: Hooking?
channel.description:
New question Bottom post :)
This topic is still relevant!

item.title: Hooking?
item.dc:creator: @serjik serjik_
item.description:
@serjik wrote:

[quote=“ringer24, post:8, topic:251049”]I’ve been trying to make an updater although my attempts have not gone well. I’m having trouble finding specific methods. I DO understand each method has something unique about it.

The way I’ve been looking for a method is using JBE and looking at peoples outputs trying to find what they have “hooked”. (I’ll code a searcher later, because I’m at school) I just need to be pointed in the right direction!

BTW I am using the bank’s Updater source.

Oh and sorry for all the questions lol.[/quote]you are confusing two things: bytecode manipulation and retrieving members of a class using reflection.

if you want to retrieve the member of a certain class during runtime, use reflection…but, you can also inject bytecode using a library such as bcel that returns the specified member.

Read full topic

item.title: Hooking?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

i assume you really meant bytecode or reflection, the current trend seems to be bytecode

people call different things hooks, but generally they are referring to the way that information is pulled from the client

Read full topic

item.title: Hooking?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

  1. Use ASM
  2. By asking this question I take it you don’t know what a hook is?
    They allow you to find classes, fields etc, even when RuneScape updates and their obfuscated names change. So yes, you need them, unless you want to make a colour clicker, in which case #1 would be irrelevant.

Read full topic
